options.a: A technique for training computers to mimic the human brain.
options.b: A type of software used in self-driving cars.
options.c: A branch of computer science focused on analyzing MRI images.
options.d: A method of communication used in Customer Support bots.

questions.question: 2. What is one of the key applications of deep learning?

options.a: Designing new types of artificial intelligence.

questions.question: 3. How does deep learning differ from traditional machine learning?

options.a: Deep learning uses a single layer of artificial neural networks, while traditional machine learning uses multiple layers.
options.b: Deep learning requires less data to train than traditional machine learning.
options.c: Deep learning uses artificial neural networks with multiple layers, while traditional machine learning uses simpler algorithms.
options.d: Deep learning focuses on predicting future events, while traditional machine learning focuses on analyzing past data.

questions.question: 4. Deep learning has been used in medical care to
5. What is the role of artificial neural networks in deep learning?

options.a: They are used to store and process data.
options.b: They are used to simulate the human brain.
options.c: They are used to create complex algorithms.
options.d: They are used to analyze and interpret data.

questions.question: 6. Which of the following is NOT a benefit of deep learning?

options.a: Ability to learn from large datasets.
options.c: Ability to work without human supervision.
options.d: Ability to replace human experts in all fields.

questions.question: 7. What is the relationship between deep learning and artificial intelligence?

options.a: Deep learning is a subset of artificial intelligence.
options.b: Artificial intelligence is a subset of deep learning.
options.c: Deep learning and artificial intelligence are separate fields.
options.d: Deep learning is a synonym for artificial intelligence.

questions.question: 8. What is the significance of the vast amount of data needed for deep learning?

options.a: It helps the machine learn faster.
options.b: It helps the machine become more accurate.
options.c: It helps the machine generalize its knowledge.

questions.question: 9. Which of these is a real-world example of deep learning in action?

options.c: A facial recognition system unlocking your phone.

questions.question: 10. Deep learning is a relatively new field. When did it start gaining significant popularity?
